meanings.sent1: The waiter poured a glass of spumante for the couple celebrating their anniversary.
meanings.sent2: At the party, everyone enjoyed a glass of spumante to toast to the new year.
meanings.sent3: The bubbles in the spumante tickled my nose as I took a sip.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled up like a glass of spumante, infectious and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The spumante sparkled in the sunlight, looking like liquid diamonds in a glass.

meanings.sent1: When you shake the bottle, the soda will spumante and overflow.
meanings.sent2: The soap spumantes as you scrub your hands vigorously.
meanings.sent3: The excitement in the room seemed to spumante, ready to burst at any moment.
meanings.sent4: Her anger spumanted like a volcano, threatening to erupt at any second.
meanings.sent5: The pot on the stove began to spumante, signaling that the pasta was almost ready.
